column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Twelve Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 848 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday
column5: 698 on Tuesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are 427 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column7: down from 429 on Tuesday.There are 33 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column8: down from 35 on Tuesday.Last updated 17 November at 14:10 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 592 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Wednesday.Last updated 16 November at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
column11: 633 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Wednesday
column13: 449 on Tuesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column16: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 634 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals.There are 119 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units.Last updated 17 November at 17:50 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column18: 482 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3
